question: Suppose you discovered a mutant yeast whose glycolytic pathway was shorter because of the presence of a new enzyme catalyzing the reaction <image 1> Would shortening the glycolytic pathway in this way benefit the cell?
description: The image depicts a chemical reaction in the glycolytic pathway. The reactants are glyceraldehyde 3-phosphate and water (H₂O), and the products are 3-phosphoglycerate, NADH, and H⁺. The reaction involves the conversion of glyceraldehyde 3-phosphate to 3-phosphoglycerate, with the reduction of NAD⁺ to NADH and the release of a hydrogen ion (H⁺). This step is typically catalyzed by the enzyme glyceraldehyde 3-phosphate dehydrogenase.
